10 years in the making: One WKU alumnus finally earned his degree

Cody Tatum (’18) of Russellville, Ky., is a non-traditional graduate of WKU. He decided not to go to college right out of high school but in 2014—10 years post high school—he decided to pursue a degree in Organizational Leadership from WKU.

What better way to get the perspective of a student than to swap places with one for a whole day.  That’s exactly what the dean of WKU’s Gordon Ford College of Business did and Amy Bingham documented it in this week’s View from the Hill.

WKU relies upon many forms of social media to connect with students, alumni, fans                   and the community in order to build relationships, answer questions, welcome visitors                   to campus, and solve problems. These audiences are now more connected to WKU than                   we ever thought possible!

There are many ways that you can connect with the WKU campus community from websites                   and email to social media. We post news releases and other information about the great                   things happening at WKU - we work hard to make WKUs social media content engaging                   and interesting!
